title: Are Concord grapes just wild grapes that have become cultivated, or is there something special about them? - Quora

response.answer_text: Concord grapes are a cultivar (that is, they are wild grapes that were cultivated), one of many cultivars coming from the fox grape, itself one of 79 different species of wild grapes, many of which have many cultivars created from them. Some cultivars are also hybrids between different grape species. Concord was developed in 1849 by Ephraim Wales Bull in Concord, Massachusetts.
